message: Every Friday night all over the country, there will be incidents where automobiles are the chosen instrument of crime, pain and suffering. Ban happy hour, ban beer, ban cars......kind of silly. Not going to happen. In the US we have good laws but the problem is the enforcement of those laws. I think career professional politicians continue to let the public down, time and time again. Either have law or have disorder.

The answer to that is yes, they can. Maybe a specific airline has a policy telling them to be nice about it but airlines don't make laws. The feds do and this flight attendant is protected by the law.

Government being, among other purposes, instituted to protect the consciences of men from oppression, it certainly is the duty of Rulers, not only to abstain from it themselves, but according to their stations, to prevent it in others. -- George Washington

The US sprayed carcinogenic pesticides on California grape harvesters decades ago. The same systemic pesticide in Canada is regulated to not be applied for at least three weeks prior to harvest. The USA without warning to parents or other adults, aerial spray above pedestrians on side walks & childrens school grounds.
